intro: Centaurea stiriaca, commonly known as the Stiriaca knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers and bristly leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a compact growth habit with upright stems and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Centaurea stiriaca is known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and is often found in disturbed areas.
